Text:
I'm shown into a large chamber, similar to
a grand hall.

(It has shiny marble floors and is lined
with columns, like a Greek temple.)

(And flanking the red carpet running to
the back of the room are two rows of
beautiful women.)

(The moment I set foot in the room, the women all
bow in unison.)
(At the very back is a giant chair.)

(It's like a fine work of art where it sits, bathing in
the crimson light of the evening sun.)
(There is no one is sitting in it.)

(Beside the chair stands a gorgeous elf with indigo-
colored hair.)

(She's a classy woman with the figure of a model,
wrapped in a captivating black dress. And I know
her face.)

We've been awaiting a visit from you for some time,
my lord.

(Here before me, bowing her head in reverence like
a beautiful actress, is...)
...Gamma.
...So this is your store.
Yes.

Think of it as a meager recreation of the smallest
portion of god-like knowledge my lord has
bestowed upon me.
Now it all makes sense.
(She ranks third in seniority after Alpha and Beta.)

(One look at those scholarly features and blue eyes
filled with intelligence is all it takes to know she is
one smart lady. It's only natural since Gamma is
the brains of the Shadow Garden.)

(Thinking back on it, I faintly recollect making some
vague, dramatized references to chocolate and other
things from my life back in Japan as "Shadow
Wisdom".)

(But I'm pretty sure all I said was that you can make
something tasty by mashing together bitter beans and
sugar and then letting it harden...)

(Guess that's how smart she is... Or how much smarter
than me she is.)
It has been a long time, my lord...
//Movie
(Her nickname is Gamma the Weak.)

(Yes, she is a veteran member of the Seven Shadows,
but in terms of combat ability she comes in dead last.)

(The Seven Shadows are the first seven members of the
Shadow Garden. I chose the name because it sounded
cool.)

(If Delta has the best battle instincts of the seven,
Gamma definitely has the worst.)

(But if I had to voice my personal thoughts on the
matter, the two of them are undeniably one-of-a-
kind. Saying that would likely infuriate Gamma
and delight Delta, but it's the absolute truth.)

(I learned two things when I taught Gamma and Delta
how to wield a blade.)

(One: No matter how good someone's instincts are,
nothing you say can help a bonehead.)

(Two: No matter how smart someone is, nothing you say
can help them if they have no instincts.)

(That's why I decided to give both of them the exact
same instructions: "Put as much magic as you can
into every blow.")

(That was the most I could ask of them—pounding foes
into submission physically, the exact kind of fighting
style I loathe.)

(Yep, my way of doing things met an all-too-easy
defeat in the face of those two.)
(Just remembering that day still makes my head hurt.)
(No, let's stop there. Best to forget it all.)

One of the women nearby wipes away the blood that
dribbles from Gamma's nose.

(A thought enters my head as I see Gamma blush:
She hasn't grown a bit.)
(I take a seat in the big chair on Gamma's cue.)

A grand, airy hall. Crimson sunlight shining in from
the skylight. Beautiful women kneeling.

(Yeah... I could get used to this. I feel like a king,
a true eminence in shadow. Gotta hand it to
Gamma for shelling out so much for this
setup...)
I feel moved by the grand gesture.

Bluish-purple magic gathers in the palm of my right
hand, shooting upward.

The radiance rises almost to the ceiling, bursting
into countless glimmers that showers the
hall.
Bask in your reward...

A rain of light falls upon the kneeling women, bathing
their bodies in its blue-purple glow for a moment.

(The only real effect it'll have is alleviating some
weariness, improving magic circulation, or maybe
healing minor wounds, but oh well.)
My lord...

Tears suddenly begin to pour from the corners of
Gamma's eyes. Seeing the familiar color of his
magic, she recalls many nostalgic memories.

I remember it well...The beautiful radiance of life
that delivered me from despair and pain...
Her life began with that same blue-violet light.

Without Cid, she would've met her end as nothing more
than a rotten mound of flesh. She lost everything, and
the one who saved her from the brink of fear, pain,
and hopelessness...was this boy and his light.

His blue-violet light contains life. Alpha said that
at some point.

Gamma could agree with that, not necessarily in
theory but on an instinctual level.

She was reborn that day. And that moment she decided
that she would offer her new life to her savior.

But contrary to her desires, Gamma occupied a
position near the bottom of the Seven Shadows.

Surpassed by newcomers who joined later, she faced
many defeats and repeated humiliations as she
scraped along.

At some point she came to the realization that she
would never win, no matter how hard she may try.

Gamma wracked her brain. What was the value of her
existence?

She would rather disappear than continue as she was.
Yet on the day she decided to do just that, for some
reason, her lord summoned her.
He then bestowed upon her words of "Shadow Wisdom."

A way of fighting in battle not with physical might,
but with the mind.

Gamma threw herself headlong into this Shadow Wisdom.
Feeling that this was her only means of survival, she
devoted her life to emulating her lord's wisdom to
the letter.

She would later realize that her lord must have seen
everything. He knew of her dilemma and the path
she needed to travel, and that's why he bestowed
this "Shadow Wisdom" onto her.

What Gamma felt in that moment was sorrow. Did her
lord truly have need of her? Having him so hopelessly
far beyond her reach truly brought her pain.

But once she grows the Shadow Garden even bigger and
stronger, into an organization truly worthy of his majesty...
...then surely her desire would be fulfilled.

I shall treasure the honor you have bestowed upon me
today for as long as I live.
You've done well, Gamma.
By the way, I'd like to know more about this company.
Ask whatever you wish, my lord.
Do the other Seven Shadows know about all of this?
Yes, of course.
(That means...)

(I'm the only one that was kept out of the loop
But I get that, since it can be hard to bring the
sole guy in on a secret when it's all girls.)
A-And the store is making quite a bit of money?

Yes. Currently, we have branches in major cities
both within and outside of Midgar and continue
to grow steadily.

However, the important matter is how much we
can use the expansion of our operations as cover
to spread our roots through the shadows.
Our funds amount to around 100 million zeni...
Oh no! Is that not enough, my lord?!
No...

(It's all making sense now. They left me in the dark
while they made a fortune using what I had taught
them.)

(They could've at least given me a teensy bit
of the action.)

(I would've never had to crawl around scrounging for
coins in the dirt...)

(...or act like a dog for money if they had helped
out.)

(Eh, but this is fine. She put together this massive
setup for me. That's enough... But, well, if they're
raking in that much, maybe...)
(No, no. Being a mooch here would be a bad move.)

My lord, if I may infer the reason for your visit.
You're here about the incidents, yes?
Huh? Uh, yeah...
(I nod. But what incidents does she mean?)

My apologies. We have investigations underway but
have yet to identify the culprit...
However, it won't take much longer.
This killer stalking the capital...

I, Gamma, swear that I shall put an end to this fool
that dares to clad himself in black and sully the
name of the Shadow Garden.
Hmm...

(Po and Skel did mention something about a slasher,
now that I think about it...)
A killer, eh...?
That does ring a bell. I’ll look into it.

Could it be you've already solved the riddle...?!
Although, for one of my lord's ability, I suppose
that is to be expected...

Gamma feels her heart skip a beat at her lord's tone.
He had plucked a clue as if from the air, something
she had failed to do even after mobilizing all her
subordinates.

But Gamma remains undeterred. Someday, her lord will
see her worth... She vows to never give up until that
comes to pass.
Come here.
Yes.

Gamma calls forth the woman with dark brown hair who
had brought Cid here.
I present to you Nu, number thirteen.

Though she is still new to our ranks, her skills have
earned the approval of Lady Alpha. Please use her
as you see fit, my lord.
Very well.

Cid takes a closer look at this "Nu." His keen eyes
reading each and every one of her aptitudes.
I...look forward to serving you, my lord.
I'll call for you when you're needed.
Yes, my lord.
Nu bows and takes her leave.
Well, I suppose I'll be off.
Oh, right.

I want to buy some chocolate. Three of the cheapest
kind you've got.

I'll have our very finest prepared for you. At a hundred
percent discount.
(I focus every nerve in my body as I speak to Gamma.)
100%?! That means it's free! Lucky me!!!

(I extend my slime, grabbing the gold coins without
anyone noticing.)

(I then tuck them into the cuff of my pants. If this
maneuver can fool Alpha and Delta, there's no
way Gamma will catch on.)

Very good, my lord. We shall prepare your chocolate
at once.

Gamma's heart warms at the sight of her lord playing
the part of his mundane guise, Cid Kagenou, so
thoroughly.
